description: image of an inverted portrait of a man with a red hat reflected within two glass vessels
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
signed: Signature and date LR corner in pencil
text: Barbara Swann is known for her complex still lifes, often including reflections and refractions from vessels full of liquid. Here, the fellow in the red hat is based on a portrait by the famous Italian renaissance artist Sandro Botticelli (1445–1510), now in the National Gallery, Washington DC.
title: Still Life with Portrait and Vessels of Water
